name: Testdummy
description: Test

name: Swordsmen
description: Swordsmen are the most basic and balanced unit in most armies. They can fight well in most situation and can hold their lines well enough. Truly the Jack of all trade of all units that are safest to pick in unknown situations. But of course, jacks of all trade lack specialities that make them stand out in a specific situation. If you by some means manage to learn the enemy composition from in and out, it will be better to employed troops that are more specialised or you can still pick Swordsmen if you like well-balanced units.

name: Swordsmasters
description: Swordmasters are the finest master who dedicates their entire lives to the way of the sword. The rumour is that each of them can easily defeat 10 opponents at once with a single stoke. Regardless of whether the rumour is true or not, there is no denying that these Swordmasters can not only fight against a much larger force, they can defeat a monster or even a giant. But being so few in number, they are vulnerable to magic or pinpoint range attack.

name: Sword Saints
description: Sword Saints are the greatest exemplar of all fighters in the realm under the heaven. Not only exceptional fighters but also extraordinary leaders who inspire all those that follow them. Additionally, they can also use magic to boost their fighting capability, which makes them extremely versatile in almost every scenario. Even though they are well-versed in melee combat, it may be better to place them in the centre of the battalion so they can keep boosting the morale of nearby squads for the entire battle.

name: Footmen
description: Footmen are professional soldiers who served as the core of the well-trained army. With better training than common Swordsmen, they possess much higher melee combat proficiency along with greater discipline. Choosing them as frontline units is never the wrong choice but do expect some difficulty when facing against charging cavalry battalion.

name: Desert Swordsmen
description: Desert is no place for armours used in other regions. Due to the extreme heat, Desert Swordsmen are equipped with hardened leather armours and desert clothing such as the turban and loose cloth to protect against the heat and desert winds. This makes Desert Swordsmen a variant of swordsmen that are specialised in desert warfare that sacrifice armour for more heat resistance and movement speed.

name: Mirage Sword Warriors
description: The worst desert folktale comes true. When the City of Mirage decide that you are a threat they will send an army of Mirage Sword Warriors to annihilate your very home. Even though, they lack decent armours, their mirage trickery can fool the enemies' eyes which make them extremely hard to hit. They are also much faster than common Swordsmen of the same grade, so try to use heavy units to hold them down and flank them with another melee units.

name: Band of Brotherhood
description: Band of Brotherhood is a group of mercenary led by General Ogiyus that travel across the continent for employment in war. Anyone that can pay a quite steep price will be ensured of getting the "finest" infantry in the land (According to the general himself). All in all, they are one of the biggest and most infamous mercenary band out there and their ability does match their reputation. Though their combat capability is not that much higher than common light sword infantry units, they have confidently excellent morale and discipline, along with better armour and charge power.

name: Slaves
description: Slavery often has a complex relationship with warfare in many cultures including the real-world historical societies. Slave labours either from war prisoners or criminals were often forced into battle as cheap meatshields for the main troop or as desperate measure. As good as any other malnourished worker slaves and with absurdly poor equipment, they are not that fitted for combat against any well-armed foes. Their morale is also extremely low so they will run the first chance they get.

name: Slave Warriors
description: Slaves are not only useful for forced labours. In some cultures, there are actually slaves trained for combat and warfare with even promising opportunity to rise the rank of the social hierarchy if they manage to display extraordinary feats. A good example of this would be Janissaries of the Ottoman empire that consist mostly of enslaved Christians. However, the example is in somewhat rare cases, most Slave Warriors are usually of lower quality due to their quality of life and existed mostly to enlarge the troop number.

name: Slave Gladiators
description: Gladiators are martial athletes of the ancient world. The most famous example and of course the unit's name origin is the Gladiators of the Roman Empire. Similar to other kinds of athlete, Gladiators use martial ability to entertain the spectators. Although Gladiators can volunteer, some are forced to be a gladiator by slavery in order to earn their "promised" freedom. And since martial ability can be used in warfare, Slave Gladiators can be employed to fight for the nation's demands as well.

name: Yalak Chosens
description: These Yalak Chosens were war prisoners that are bought to be trained as slave warrior to the Martial deity, "Yalak the Almighty". The priests of Coduikewq then "educate" them to become terrifying and fierce warriors that devote their entire life to the teaching of Mokudun, "Only Will of Battle". Only a few selected can become the chosen and the rest are discarded. Donned in specially made buffalo leather armours and iron khopeshes, their only weakness is the lack of shield to block missile attack.

name: Gosunma Servants
description: The Servants of Gosunma are "slaves" by their wills. They dedicate their whole life following the bidding of their master without a shred of disobedience. For the words of Gosunma, "The Legal Masters", are absolute. Although classified as "Slave", Servants of Gosunma are extremely well trained in the art of combat and devoted to their masters. they can decently hold up in the frontline with their steel bucklers and swords. They are also good shock units that can charge from both the front and flank positions.

name: Mob
description: Mob groups may often be seen as easy targets in warfare. But when it comes to rebellion, a group of peasants is often the bane of tyrants. Although a bit better equipped than slaves and have better morale, mobs are still not well-versed in combat as common soldiers due to the lack of training. Their only advantage is huge troop number and low cost so their main tactic is to swarm the enemies from all sides.

name: Tribespeople
description: A mob of tribe people is much more well-versed in combat than city-dwelling people due to the strength requires to survive in an uncivilised world. With a hunting tool in hands, they will pull any haughty blue-blooded noble down from their throne and flatten the wall of stone to the last piece. All in all, a mob of untrained peasants can still no way match with the better-trained soldiers, so use them wisely.

name: Citizen Mobs
description: Citizens usually live lavishly in the city with less demand for physical activity to survive in the harsh nature. With the lack of tools that can be a substitute as a decent weapon, Citizen mobs are even less capable of combat than other types of mobs but are somewhat more discipline than country bumpkins due to a more organised and less free lifestyle.

name: Duelists
description: Duelists are fighters that train in martial arts to perfection. They test out their martial proficiency by performing duel with other duelists to improve their skills even further. As their lives involve around combat activities, this also makes them somewhat suitable for battle. But because duelling is not really a common pastime activity, it is quite difficult to employ Duelists in large number for the entire army.

name: Gladiators
description: Arena! The place where real fighters fight for their lives and of course the entertainment of the viewers. Gladiators are warriors that can fight foe of any type or race. They have fought another gladiator, animal likes lions, a rare creature such as troll and even minotaur! They even have experience fighting in a group so this makes them truly fearsome addition to any army. There is one flaw however, Gladiators are unruly bunches with no experience in the art of warfare nor fighting along with other people different than themselves.

name: Fencers
description: The art of fencing is not about force, it is about form. Each movement must be precise and compact. As such, Fencers are extremely versatile units that are exceptional in both offence and defence. Although fencing is often considered to be an subset activity for nobles and full-time martial artists, this means that only a few manage to master this art enough to be used primarily in warfare.

name: Duel Masters
description: Very few people can live such a dangerous life long enough to be a master of it. Duel Masters are nothing short of the exceptions of the exceptional. They will never lose to anyone in a direct melee engagement and may even be able to hold out in an outnumbered fight. Obviously, being good in a duel does not make ones immune to damage. A lucky blow or arrow can still kill the master just like any mortal man.

name: Avolinas's Hammers
description: The Hammers of Avolinas can not be stopped by force alone. With faith in mind and strength in hand, They carry on the final will of Avolinas, God of Dark Sun, to eliminate any impure being that will consume the world whole if left unconstrained. Their proficiency in martial arts allow them to engage in melee combat and come out victorious in almost every condition and foes, Don't put them in the same battalion as unit from other races though since their teaching also make them consider other races less pure than they are to promote group unity.

name: Tribal Warriors
description: The tribal people are no strangers to warfare. A minor conflict between neighbour tribes is not so different from a war between the two countries.  Wearing little to no armour and wielding primitive weapon due to the lack of technology and means of production, Tribal Warriors exercise their martial ability to the fullest to ensure their tribe's survival.

name: Desert Warriors
description: Desert is not a place the weak can survive. Only the strongest live on in this harsh sea of sand. Even more so for a small tribal community securing a precious oasis or fertile land near the river. Desert Warriors are a necessity that ensures not only the dominance but also the very survival of their family. As they are lightly armed and disorganised compare to other professional troops, they are unfit for organised warfare.

name: Gamanja Warriors
description: The people of Gamanja is one of the fiercest warriors you can find in any continent. Sailing across the Sunset sea with their serpent ship since the dawn of time, many shoreline villages and cities were raided by them indiscriminately. From Agintoarze to Utokuzs, Gamanja Warriors are a fearsome force and served as a cautionary tale the elder use to scare their children.

name: Foot Knights
description: The ultimate infantry until the modernisation of weaponry, foot knights wear heavy plate armours that can withstand almost every medieval weapons in existence. In combat ground, foot knights stand so above most other infantries that the only way to win melee combat against them is to field foot knights of your own. Foot knights are not without weakness however, for example, it is extremely difficult to amass them in a huge number due to the extensive training requirement and huge cost for the armour.

name: Golden Knights
description: What metal can ever be more glorious and beautiful than gold? While not purely made of gold, Golden Knights' armours are made from the finest steel and plated with a layer of gold. Only the most distinguishable knights in the realm can earn the honour of joining the Golden Knight Rank. Just from their presence alone, they can exert a change in both allies and enemies' mind alike. Their combat capability also ensures that they are really the elite of the elites so best overwhelm them with a superior number since very few can match them one-on-one.

name: King's Companions
description: Every leader in the battlefield needs a group of elite bodyguards to protect him in case of combat. This is even more so for the sovereign of a nation. King's Companions is a group of exceptionally selected warriors that swear an oath to protect the crown and its wearer with their lives. They themselves are heavily armed and possess a strong defensive ability. When picking a bodyguard unit for your commander consider this unit as one of the solid choices for infantry orient battalion.

name: Heavy Swordsmen
description: Heavy Swordsmen, similar to its counterpart, Swordsmen, are the basic frontline units of many armies. With better-equipped armours such as chain mail to resist enemies' weapons and decent melee combat capability, they can hold up at the frontline for long enough for other units to perform flanking manoeuvre on the enemies. However, with less troop number, higher cost, and significantly slower speed than other lighter units, Heavy Swordsmen not the best choice for the purely offensive situations.

name: Desert Heavy Swordsmen
description: lamellar armour

name: Spearmen
description: Spearmen are the foundation of most armies since ancient time. Using the oldest hunting tool for war, spearmen dominate the battlefield for thousands of year. Spear is very easy to train and use as its main attack is simply thrusting the pointy tip at the enemy. It also has the advantage of being long for a melee weapon, which makes it a better choice against charging enemy. The only weaknesses are that spearmen do not have a shield and are less effective in melee combat than other melee weapons.

name: Spearmasters
description: Who can say the easiest weapon has no need to be mastered? These Spear Masters practice with their spears for decades and completely eliminate any weakness spear normally has. They can fight against both infantry and cavalry units alike without fear of losing, unlike other weapon masters. More than offense, Spear Masters excel in defence against charge attack and can hold their place much longer than other spear units despite low number. They are still venerable to range attack though.

name: Pikemen
description: Pike is the obvious answer to the dominance of shock cavalry. They can't hurt us if they can't even reach us without dying first right? A pike wall can completely halt and even annihilate any unit that dares to charge at their front. Do consider that Pikemen cannot form a pike wall formation while running around, this makes them somewhat a poor offensive unit. Moreover, they are completely vulnerable to the range and rear attack even more than other melee infantry units.

name: Heavy Spearmen
description: As Spearmen usually have trouble holding a shield, the best way for them to survive combat is to wear good armour. Heavy Spearmen somewhat eliminate the main weakness of spear weapon by allowing them to take more punishment from both melee and range hits. Nevertheless, they still are not that great in the long-term combat against other melee infantry units. So only consider employing them if the enemy employs a large number of shock troop or cavalry units.

name: Heavy Pikemen
description: With the lack of defensive capability of a pike, the only way pikemen can avoid any damage is to wear armour. Heavy Pikemen is the obvious solution to the problem. Now with better combat effectiveness in melee combat and resistance against arrows, Heavy Pikemen are proven to be superior defensive frontline units.

name: Shield Bearers
description: It may be strange for one to not carry a weapon in warfare but only shield to protect the others, Shieldbearers are still one of the best units for defensive purpose. With a massive shield, they can block enemies' missile attacks with ease, which allows them to become an ultimate meatshield for other units. They are incapable of dealing any serious damage to the enemy in melee combat though, so do not expect them to win any major engagement by themselves.

name: Protectors of Alardell
description: The Tower of Alardell holds the secret to military mastery that any competent warlord dreams of getting hold of. After many invasions throughout its history, Protectors of Alardell never once lost to the invaders even against an adversary with an overwhelming number. Such knowledge may best be left unknown after all when even an army could not pass through the first gate. Who knows what terror lies beyond.

name: Macemen
description: Macemen are not a common sight in the battlefield until the invent of heavy plate armour. Equipped with either Winged Maces or Morning Stars, Macemen are best suited against heavy infantry units due to its high armour penetration. Aside from this superb advantage, they are still no less effective than other melee infantry units, which makes them a strong choice in most situations.

name: Macemasters
description: Even a brute weapon such as mace can be used elegantly. Macemasters are the banes of all knights on the battlefield with their crushing and precise blows that no armour can resist. If only they exist in large number, the vile existence of heavy knight would be obsolete as soon as it got invented and existed only as an inconsequential point in the history of warfare.

name: Desert Macemen
description: Mace is not often seen in desert warfare due to the lack of heavy armour in this hellish heat. Only until the arrival of the western knights and their plate armours that mace becomes a necessity in the battle for the sea of sand. Still wearing desert cloths similar to Desert Swordmen, Desert Macemen are the expected adaptation to the invasion of new foes while still retain the advantage of terrain and climate for desert dwellers.

name: Billmen
description: Bill or Billhook is a polearm weapon originated from a cutting tool of the same name. Although also existed in a smaller form, Pole Bill was a popular weapon in the European middle age that share similar purpose as halberd and other glaive type weapons. Effective for both long-range piercing and slashing manoeuvres, while being lightweight makes Billhook much more flexible and easier to adapt than other polearms. As a result, Billmen is positively versatile polearm unit that exudes almost no apparent weakness.

name: Axemen
description: Axe is one of the very first cutting tools that existed since the stone age. Simple to create and use, yet capable of producing powerful blow from it monstrous momentum. Axemen is no surprise a common sight in armies throughout history and the world. Fortunately, their amazing offensive performance does outshine their slightly poorer defence, which means that they can be employed for both offensive and defensive purposes.

name: Axemasters
description: Although considered to a less romantic weapon than a sword and even less than a mace, axe still has its appeal (mostly in brute strength) enough for people to practice it until achieving complete mastery. Who need other weapons in hands when an axe cleave through anyone standing discriminately. With the combination of preciseness and pure brute force, Axemasters truly have no equal. Well except for a charging heavy cavalry unit perhaps.

name: Cultists
description: There is nothing worse than facing a group of cultists in battle. They keep chanting incomprehensible words and keep fighting without fear of dying. Whatever dark god they worship, it is for certain that they are up to no good. Good news is they usually wear robes or light armours at best so they are easy targets for range attack, which means we can kill them without having to hear their annoying chant too! It is almost like killing two birds with one stone.

name: Zealots
description: Well, this is even worse than Cultists, these zealots are so far gone that there can be no reasoning with them. Whatever fault heresy they believe, it is true in their hearts and they are more than willing to sacrifice themselves for it. Well no point talking where there is killing to do. For the words of our lord is the only truth and we should believe in him in our hearts.

name: Royal Guards
description: Only the best that prove themselves can become Royal Guards. The sovereign requires the finest protection the country can offer, as the leader is the country itself after all. Equipped with the highest quality armours and weapons, Royal Guards served as the absolute layer of protection. It will take an overwhelming number or prowess to subdue them.

name: Palace Guards
description: The place where the rulers reside in always requires the maximum security from both enemy soldiers and assassins. Palace Guards are elite troops equipped with a halberd and heavy armours. Trained to fight in both the narrow corridor and open space, Palace Guards can dispatch any foes efficiently in any situation. They are also no less than any other elite troops on the battlefield.

name: Milingrels
description: Milingrels are elite knight squads that is assigned to protect royalty at all time from any danger including in battle. They will not break, they will not yield and they will never fail. They are equipped with multiple tools and can use some magic to fulfill those mission. The leader of this unit is bestowed with the title "Royal Knight".

name: Flailmen
description: Flail is simply a mace with its head detached from the handle and connected by a set of chains. But such simplicity in this difference does not equate to its usability. Flail requires much more training to just prevent users from injuring himself before even learn how to kill the enemy with it. Flailmen are much more capable in melee combat than most other units of the same tier.

name: Monk Warriors
description: Religions may preach peace most of the time but there are times that even the most peaceful must take arms to smite the evils or at the very least to protect their faith. These Monk Warriors are trained in martial arts in an extremely strict environment that even most well-trained warriors wouldn't even dream of. Aside from the martial prowess, they also have the mind of steel that can endure in the direst situation without breaking.

name: Tranquility Monks
description: Still, if the situation gets to the point that these peaceful people are out for your blood, it may be time to go into hiding before your head get chopped off by a group of monks as a punishment for your wrongdoing.

name: Scouts
description: Intelligence is one of the key aspects of victory in warfare. Knowing the location, who is leading, and how many are the enemy troops can let one formulate a well-thought plan. Scouts are well-versed in the art of reconnaissance, skirmishing and ambushing. A battalion of Scouts leading the main army body is the basis of every capable leader's tactic. With extremely high survivability ability, the only real threat to Scouts is light cavalry units that are capable of catching up to their speed.

name: Bandits
description: The pests of early civilisation that creeping in the area where the hand of law cannot reach. Bandits are a group of people that take up arms to rob, loot and raze village or even unguarded town for their survival. Using whatever equipments they can get, Bandits are versatile units that can be used in both skirmish and serious melee engagement.  Their looting ability also allows them to gain more resource from raiding.

name: Pirates
description: The outlaws of the high sea where the dream of treasure is always in reach. Interesting enough, history seems to suggest that pirate may not always be outlaws and often are employed as privateers by many empires such as the Barbary pirates, Vikings and of course Republic of Pirates (being privateers of their very own country). Living on the sea for the major part of their life allows Pirates to become a fearsome naval force and later on a legend that fascinates people of the future.

name: City Guards
description: Law and order is the foundation of every society. Before the existence of modern police is the group of militia or volunteer that served as the City Guards that enforce the law, catch the criminals and any other menial tasks. Usually armed with polearms and light armour, they are less suited for an open field battle but more on urban combat.

name: Crusader
description: The holy warriors set out to reclaim the holy land. Crusaders follow what God tells them to do and believe his teaching in their heart. No infidel will escape from the wrath of righteous. Their devotion allows them to fight with fervour and fury that no common man can achieve. The path to heaven is only opened to those who are willing to cross pass it.

name: Hell Vanquisher
item: Strength Potion, Speed Potion, Stamina Potion

name: Gayarln Masked Barodories
description: These masked armoured glaive wielding nun warriors are nothing but terrifying sight to behold. Fortunately, they only take part in a battle only if they consider their temple to be in danger. The lord Gayarta once said: "No one but Barodory can be the master of this gate (The gate to middle celestial order)"

name: Archers
description: In ancient time, archery is everything. It is survival, it is tradition, it is honour and it is victory. Archery allows human more chance to survive in a dangerous hunt than the other primitive hunting tool due to its long-range. Often time society creates a tradition for practising archery since childhood as its mastery is extremely difficult to achieve. Unsurprisingly, the most efficient tool to hunt animals become the most efficient tool to kill another human in warfare. Capable of loosing arrows with short bows, archers are superb additions in any army.

name: Foot Archers
description: Often times, archers do not equip heavy armours or heavy melee weapon in battle because there are no such needs for them. It is the duty of melee infantries to protect them from such a threat. But in a few exceptional scenarios, archers may need to be prepared for melee engagement. If the situation requires it, these Foot Archers are more prepared for such demand and may even survive after the bloodbath.

name: Shortbow Archers
description: Although lacking the stopping power of the heavier bow, shortbow makes up for the glaring weakness with superb drawing speed. Shortbow Archers are capable of swiftly raining volley of arrows that can botch the sky. As such, Shortbow Archers are superior to other range units when one's tactic is to quickly dispatch the enemy as soon as possible. But beware that such a tactic will exhaust the ammunition rapidly.

name: Noble Archers
description: It is not uncommon for nobles to pick up archery as their way of combat in a society where chivalry concept is less prominent. With superior wealth and training, Noble Archers carry better quality bow and armour into battle and skillfully shoot down the enemy. They also equipped themselves with meaningful melee sidearms in case the enemy manages to penetrate through the lowly melee troops in the frontline.

name: Light Crossbowmen
description: Carrying a lighter version of the crossbow, Light Crossbowmen served as a skirmish infantry rather than a ranged damage dealer, unlike its heavier counterpart. With superior movement speed but somewhat inferior killing force, this unit is best used to flank the enemy and rain death from their rear.

name: Crossbowmen
description: A group of peasants or militias trained to use a crossbow for a week can already accomplish what archers need to learn for a year. Although not really well-trained, their reload speed is much slower than archers and their bow. But once loaded, a volley of steel bolts can destroy even a group of heaviest knights. As long as it hit the target that is.

name: Songes
description: Songes is a group of rangers wielding light crossbow that patrol the Forest of Estaliart as most of the monsters that dwell in that forest have thick skin enough to resist the arrow from a bow. Although consist of mostly volunteer and conscript, these rangers are experienced enough to travel through most forest unhindered.

name: Heavy Crossbowmen
description: The invention of the crossbow also sparks for the invention of even heavier armour to resist its penetration power. Heavy Crossbowmen wield such heavy crossbow that requires a specialised tool to helps with the reloading process. The payoff, however, is tremendous as a shot from these crossbows is surely capable of killing any knight that a lighter crossbow incapable of accomplishing.

name: Armoured Crossbowmen
description: It is a fact that a crossbow is much less effective when shooting in an arc degree (similar to a gun). This means that often time Crossbowmen are required to be in the frontline to shoot at the enemy, which pose a risk of exposure to melee combat. Armoured Crossbowmen who armed themselves in heavier armours and weaponry can serve in both roles.

name: Knightslayers
description: Very few can claim to be the killer of knights for that would mean they are the strongest force in the old world. But with a heavy crossbow in hands, a group of well-trained troops will discharge message of death to anyone who dares be in the front of such force. And thus the pyramid of society change once again.

name: Pavise Crossbowmen
description: As reloading does not require the shooter to keep looking at the enemy, it is almost an obvious solution to put a shield on one's back and simply turn body backwards and use the shield to protect against incoming arrows while reloading the crossbow. In the trade-off between two ranged infantry units, Pavise Crossbowmen usually are the one that will come out on top.

name: Dragon Slayers
description: To be a killer of greatest creature in the world is the highest glory one can possibly get. The Dragon Slayers are the most well trained and equiped groups to accomplish just that.

name: Slingers
description: Who would expect a piece of stone can be so devastating even for those in armour? Sling remain one of the most effective way to kill enemies in skirmish battle even today .

name: Malorn Patrols
description: Patrols of Malorn mountain paths use slingshot as their main weapon due to the abundance of small rock.

name: Night Hunters
description: The children of the night can not be revealed by the mere light of the moon. In the mystery of the dark there lies the Night Hunters. No sleeping animal is safe from the sight of Night Hunters nor the sleeping soldier with the ability to loose arrow no less accurate than during the day. Such proficiency comes at the cost of extensive training and not many can accomplish such feat.

name: Light Horsemen
description: Light Horsemen are superb scouting and harassing cavalry units due to extremely high movement speed. Very few can catch up to Light Horsemen speed but their effectiveness existed only for those purposes. In the hand of a capable commander, they can create maximum chaos to the enemy army and allows other units to engage the enemy in more favourable terms.

name: Knights
description: For a warrior to become a knight is no easy task. Aside from talent, oftentimes fame, wealth and connection are required for a noble to grant any person a knight. Such title, however, comes with not only an honour but also support to uphold the finest equipment and training befit the title. Although knighthood is different in each country, the most shared concept of the knight is a heavily mounted warrior.

name: Men At Arms
description: Men at Arms referred to many types of warriors in the middle age, but to put simply, they are a group of well-trained warriors serving an employer. Typically mounted and proficient in melee weaponry, they can charge through the enemy line with ease. As Men at Arms can come from different background, the skill standard in the unit often fluctuates when compare to Knights.

name: Heavy Horsemen
description: It does not take long after the discovery of horse riding that civilisations begin to find its use in the matter of warfare. With superior speed come superior impact, Heavy Horsemen is the dawn of cavalry dominant in the battlefield. Equipped with heavy armour and weapon, they can overwhelm even a group of Spearmen in the right condition. Unsurprisingly though, the cost of equipment and horse maintenance is not cheap so only the wealthy nation can field an army of Heavy Horsemen in a battle.

name: Elephant Riders
description: Elephants are no stranger to the battlefield than horses throughout the history of warfare. From North Africa to Asia, elephants are adapted as heavy cavalry units but also for the shock values for the enemy. With a massive body and surprisingly good swiftness, no soldier nor horseman can match against Elephant Riders in term of destruction. However, no training can defeat the scarediness of elephants that can make them out of control easily.

name: Lancers
description: To win against another cavalry, simply bring a weapon that is longer than what the opponent will be using. Lancers are the solution to counter the dominance of cavalry by being the better offensive cavalry themselves. Bearing a long lance, Lancers' charge is much more devastating than other heavy cavalry units. However, they are much less effective in melee combat making them more suitable as shock cavalry rather than primary melee cavalry.

name: Mounted Archers
description: The conquerors of the old world. Unmatched in the flat plain even by the heavy knights who dominate the age-old battlefield. Mounted Archers are the first glimpse into the new era of warfare where speed decide the victor. Mounted Archers unequally excel in skirmish tactics. Very few units can match the speed of Mount Archers and can engage them in melee combat. When facing against such foes, bait them into unsuitable terrain that reduces their speed and decimate them before they can retreat.

name: Gastornis Scouts
description: Gastornis is a flightless bird that is large and strong enough to carry a person weight and medium baggage with the speed of no inferior to a pony. Although Gastornis is already extinct in the real world, they are found abundance near the Red Forest "Wqotmotyg". They become a prided domesticated mount of Astedern people. Gastornis Scouts can traverse through forest effortlessly unlike horse cavalry.

name: Camel Riders
description: Camel is a staple means of transportation in the desert land since ancient time. With superior adaptivity in high heat area, camel is an excellent replacement to a horse as a cavalry mount despite the somewhat slower speed. Additionally, camel also has a peculiar smell that horse dislike and render them less effective in battle this makes Camel Riders an effective cavalry and anti-cavalry unit at the same time.
